Authority thrives on fear, on dictating what is and isn't acceptable. They criminalize drugs to maintain power, to keep people docile and manageable. But when we choose to consume, to rebel with our bodies and minds, we say: *Your laws don't own me. Your fear doesn't define me.*

My pleasure is not a crime.* 

And it’s not just about the act—it’s about the community it builds. The underground networks, the shared secrets, the solidarity in the face of persecution. That’s the real threat to them. Because when people come together in ways they can’t control, they can’t silence us. We’re not just users—we’re agitators. We’re the chaos they fear.
